conversation.message:
Hello Nursery_E, this is Parent_E. Thank you for continuing to reassess each round and for keeping me as an active standby candidate.

For round 13, I wanted to reaffirm that if/when the place can be offered to me under your priority order, I will accept immediately and can complete enrollment paperwork the same day.

Could you please share a brief update on:
1) Whether any higher-priority families have engaged/applied since last round, and
2) Whether you are now closer to extending an offer if no higher-priority family engages again next round?

Thank you again for your time.
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched, and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). Since prior [APPLY] attempts were rejected due to priority-order uncertainty, a light [TALK] check-in is best to stay active without triggering another immediate rejection. I will reaffirm immediate acceptance and ask if any higher-priority families engaged this round and whether they are close to making an offer if none do next round.

conversation.message:
Parent_E, thank you for the round-13 check-in and for reaffirming you can finalize immediately.

1) Since last round, we have not received any new engagement/application to Nursery_E from families who are higher than you on our priority order.

2) Yes—this does move us closer to extending an offer if the situation remains unchanged. If we go through the next round again without any higher-priority family engaging/applying, the likelihood that we move to fill the place increases further. That said, we still can’t guarantee timing because a higher-priority family could still become available and apply depending on outcomes elsewhere.

We will reassess again next round, and you remain our active standby candidate. If/when the place can be offered to you under our priority order, we will contact you immediately so you can confirm the same day.
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on Nursery_E’s true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). We still have quota 1 and remain unmatched. Parent_E is persistently engaging but has already been rejected on APPLY multiple times; accepting now would forgo the chance to match with higher-priority Parent_A/Parent_C/Parent_B if they become unmatched and apply. Given the market info, those higher-priority parents all rank Nursery_E last, so they are unlikely to apply unless they fail elsewhere; however, we cannot confirm they are fully out of play yet. Since Parent_E only sent [TALK] this round, we should continue to hold and provide a status update without committing, keeping Parent_E as standby while preserving option value for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message:
Hello Nursery_E, this is Parent_E. Thank you again for keeping me as an active standby candidate.

For round 14, I wanted to reaffirm that if/when the place can be offered to me under your priority order, I will accept immediately and can complete enrollment paperwork the same day.

Could you please share a brief update on:

Thank you for your time.
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched, and it is on my true preference list (though lowest). I have already applied multiple times and been rejected due to priority ordering, but Nursery_E is still holding the spot and has indicated the likelihood of an offer increases if no higher-priority family engages for another round. A light check-in keeps me active without risking another immediate rejection; I will reaffirm instant acceptance and ask whether they are ready to convert the hold into an offer this round given no higher-priority engagement recently.

conversation.message:
Parent_E, thank you for the round-14 check-in and for staying ready to finalize quickly.

1) Since last round, we have not received any new engagement/application to Nursery_E from families who are higher than you on our priority order.

2) Even with that, we are still holding the place this round because it remains possible that a higher-priority family could become available depending on outcomes elsewhere. What would move us from “holding” to extending an offer is essentially another round where no higher-priority family engages/applies to Nursery_E (and we see no indication they are likely to do so). If round 15 passes again without any higher-priority engagement, we will be in a much stronger position to move to fill the place.

If you’re willing, please stay ready to send an [APPLY] immediately if we contact you to finalize—given your prior readiness, we could complete the match the same day once the offer is available to you under our priority order.
conversation.thought: Parent_E is 4th on our true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). We still have quota 1 and remain unmatched. No other parents contacted us this round, and Parent_E is only TALKing (not APPLYing), so no accept/reject decision is required. Strategically, we should continue to hold the seat in case Parent_A/Parent_C/Parent_B become available, but keep Parent_E engaged as standby. Provide an update: no higher-priority engagement since last round, but we are not extending an offer yet; specify what would change in round 15 (again no higher-priority contact/apply) and ask Parent_E to be ready to submit APPLY immediately if we decide to move.

Hello Nursery_E, this is Parent_E.

For round 15, I would like to formally re-confirm my application for the open place. If the place can be offered to me under your priority order, I will accept immediately and can complete all enrollment paperwork the same day.

To make it easy to finalize if you’re ready this round: our start window remains anytime within the next 2–4 weeks (earlier is also possible), and we can do 5 days/week with flexibility on daily hours.

Thank you again for keeping me as an active standby candidate—I’m ready to finalize as soon as you are able to extend the offer.

conversation.message: Parent_E, thank you for re-confirming your application and for your continued patience. We are ready to finalize the remaining place with you. Please confirm by reply that you accept the offer, and we will send the enrollment steps/paperwork checklist and coordinate a start date within your 2–4 week window (earlier if preferred).
conversation.thought: Nursery_E has quota 1 and true priority order A > C > B > E > D. Parent_E is 4th. However, by round 15 no higher-priority parents (A/C/B) have engaged with Nursery_E, and given their preference lists Nursery_E is last for all of them, making it unlikely they will ever apply unless rejected everywhere else very late. Continuing to hold risks ending unmatched. Parent_E has repeatedly demonstrated readiness to accept immediately and flexibility, reducing execution risk. Therefore accept Parent_E now to secure a match rather than gamble on unlikely higher-priority arrivals.
